intro: Sinocarum wolffianum, commonly known as the Wolffian sinocarum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
